abstract: Urbanization and lowered birth rate contribute to rise of abandoned properties in suburbs around Tokyo, like Yokosuka; so-called ghost homes, which are estimated to number eight million, are becoming blight on landscape; government is exploring ways to make properties, many of which were built during post World War II labor boom, attractive for sale, but lack of interested buyers is problem not easily solved.
lead_paragraph: Some eight million unoccupied homes across Japan are the most visible sign of human retreat in a country where the population is forecast to fall by a third over the next 50 years.

headline.main: A Sprawl of Ghost Homes in Aging Tokyo Suburbs
headline.print_headline: A Sprawl of Ghost Homes in Aging Tokyo Suburbs
